did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: James O. Morris Collection of Labor Related Tape Recordings, 1960-1969
did.physdesc: Audio cassette tapes, open-reel audio tapes, pamphlets.
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection consists of 10 audio reels and 1 cassette tape, collected by James Morris.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: 1-Agricultural organizing, 2-Emma Goldman, 3-Folklore of the American Labor Movement, 4-Man from Terre Haute and His Cause, Eugene Debs, 5-Norman Thomas & Eugene Debs 6-San Francisco Waterfront and General Strike pt.1, 7-pt.2, 8-She also ran-Victoria Woodhull, 9-What ever became-Warren K. Billings, 10-When labor was a dirty word

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: James O. Morris Collection of Labor Related Tape Recordings #5518 AV. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: bx 3-The Growth of American Trade Unions, the Policies of the American Federation of Labor / The Growth of American Trade Unions the Impact of Industrial Unionism ; bx4-The New Deal and the Domestic Party / The New Deal and its Effects on Foreign Policy ; bx5-Parties, Patronage and the Political - Machines in America / The New Politics ; bx6-American Politics in the Age of Jackson - Parties and Sections in the 1820's / American Politics in the Age of Jackson - Whigs and Democrats in the 1830's
